summary: This is an FBI Collected Item Log documenting the receipt of an Apple iPhone XS from Shannon Farrar, an associate at the Law Offices of Montell Figgins, who was representing Michael Thomas. The phone was collected as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation, and a consent form signed by Thomas was provided.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a collected item log from the FBI's death investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. He is listed as the subject (UNSUB) of the investigation.

persons.name: Shannon Farrar
persons.role: Associate at Law Offices of Montell Figgins
persons.context: Shannon Farrar provided an Apple iPhone XS to the FBI Special Agent. She is an associate at the law firm representing Michael Thomas and witnessed his consent form.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.role: Client of Law Offices of Montell Figgins
persons.context: Michael Thomas is the individual who owned the iPhone XS that was collected. He signed a consent form allowing the search of the device, which was witnessed by his attorney's associate, Shannon Farrar.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.context: Montell Figgins is the named principal of the law firm (Law Offices of Montell Figgins) whose associate, Shannon Farrar, provided the iPhone to the FBI on behalf of client Michael Thomas.

connections.description: Farrar, as an associate at the Law Offices of Montell Figgins, was acting on behalf of and representing client Michael Thomas when she provided his iPhone to the FBI.
Farrar is identified as an associate at the Law Offices of Montell Figgins.
The law firm led by Montell Figgins was representing Michael Thomas, as evidenced by their associate handling the transfer of his property to the FBI.

events.title: Consent Form Signed for iPhone Search
events.description: Michael Thomas signed a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General consent form (OIG-Form 233/4) authorizing the search of his Apple iPhone XS. The form was witnessed by his legal representative, Shannon Farrar.

events.title: FBI Receipt of iPhone XS
events.description: An FBI Special Agent received an Apple iPhone XS from Shannon Farrar. The agent placed the phone in airplane mode and provided Farrar with a property receipt (FD-597).

locations: Law Offices of Montell Figgins, 17 Academy Street, suite 305, Newark, New Jersey
keyFacts: The FBI collected an Apple iPhone XS (IMEI: 357208091738649) as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation (Case ID 90A-NY-3151227).
The phone was provided by Shannon Farrar, an associate at the Law Offices of Montell Figgins, who was representing the phone's owner, Michael Thomas.
Michael Thomas had unlocked the iPhone and turned off its security codes before it was handed over to the FBI.
Thomas signed a formal DOJ OIG consent form on August 26, 2019, authorizing the search of the electronic device, which was witnessed by Farrar.
The document explicitly states the investigation is related to 'JEFFREY EPSTEIN - VICTIM; DEATH INVESTIGATION'.
